ccre.testing

Class BaseTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • ccre.testing.BaseTest
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BaseTestList, TestAllocationPool, TestBooleanStatus, TestCHashMap, TestConcurrentDispatchArray, TestEvent, TestFloatStatus, TestReporterThread, TestTests, TestUtils

    public abstract class BaseTest
extends java.lang.Object
    A superclass for the various tests in this package. This provides a framework for the code for each test, as well as providing various assertion methods.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BaseTest()

      The object arguments should be value-equal, as in a == null ? b == null : a.equals(b)! If not, the test has failed! Report this and stop the test.

    • Method Detail

      • redirectLogging

        protected void redirectLogging(LoggingTarget newTarget)
        Redirect the destination of all CCRE logging temporarily, or disable redirection if null. Will automatically be removed at the end of a test.
        Parameters:
        newTarget - The new target to send logging to, or null to disable redirection.

      • getName

        public abstract java.lang.String getName()
        Get the name of this test.
        Returns:
        the test's name.

      • runTest

        protected abstract void runTest()
                         throws TestingException,
                                java.lang.InterruptedException
        Run this test. This will throw a TestingException if the test fails.
        Throws:
        TestingException - if the test fails.
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • test

        public final boolean test()
        Run this test verbosely. This will log various status messages during the test.
        Returns:
        true if the test succeeded and false if it failed.

      • test

        public final boolean test(boolean verbose)
        Run this test. If ran verbosely, this will log various status messages during the test.
        Parameters:
        verbose - should status messages be logged?
        Returns:
        true if the test succeeded and false if it failed.

      • assertFail

        protected void assertFail(java.lang.String message)
                   throws TestingException
        The test has failed! Report this now and stop the test.
        Parameters:
        message - the explanation of what went wrong.
        Throws:
        TestingException - always - the test has failed.

      • assertTrue

        protected void assertTrue(boolean bool,
              java.lang.String message)
                   throws TestingException
        The bool argument should be true. If it isn't, the test has failed! Report this and stop the test.
        Parameters:
        bool - the boolean to test.
        message - the explanation of what went wrong.
        Throws:
        TestingException - if bool is false.

        protected void assertEqual(int a,
               int b,
               java.lang.String message)

        The integer arguments should be equal! If not, the test has failed! Report this and stop the test.
        Parameters:
